hints.label: def-gevrey-class-cinf
hints.title: Gevrey Classes
hints.content:
752: :label: def-gevrey-class-cinf
753: 
754: A function f: U → ℝ (U ⊆ ℝ^d open) belongs to **Gevrey class G^s** (s ≥ 1) if for every compact K ⊆ U, there exist C_K, A_K > 0 such that:
755: 
756: $$
757: \sup_{x \in K} \|\nabla^m f(x)\| \leq C_K \cdot A_K^m \cdot (m!)^s \quad \forall m \geq 0
758: $$
759: 
760: **Special cases**:
761: - s < 1: Real analytic (convergent Taylor series)
762: - s = 1: **Gevrey-1** (borderline, "analytic-Gevrey")
hints.raw_directive:
749: ## 7. Gevrey-1 Classification
750: 
751: :::{prf:definition} Gevrey Classes
752: :label: def-gevrey-class-cinf
753: 
754: A function f: U → ℝ (U ⊆ ℝ^d open) belongs to **Gevrey class G^s** (s ≥ 1) if for every compact K ⊆ U, there exist C_K, A_K > 0 such that:
755: 
756: $$
757: \sup_{x \in K} \|\nabla^m f(x)\| \leq C_K \cdot A_K^m \cdot (m!)^s \quad \forall m \geq 0
758: $$
759: 
760: **Special cases**:
761: - s < 1: Real analytic (convergent Taylor series)
762: - s = 1: **Gevrey-1** (borderline, "analytic-Gevrey")
763: - s > 1: Smooth but not analytic

hints.label: thm-gevrey-1-cinf
hints.title: Gevrey-1 Regularity of the Fitness Potential
hints.content:
768: :label: thm-gevrey-1-cinf
769: 
770: V_fit[f_k, ρ](x_i) belongs to **Gevrey class G¹** for each fixed ρ > 0 and swarm configuration S. For any compact K ⊆ X and any ρ ∈ (0, ρ_0]:
771: 
772: $$
773: \sup_{x_i \in K} \|\nabla^m V_{\text{fit}}\| \leq C_K(\rho_0) \cdot \left(\frac{A_K(\rho_0)}{\rho}\right)^m \cdot m!
774: $$
775: 
776: where A_K(ρ_0) is **independent of m**, confirming Gevrey-1 classification with s = 1.
777: 
778: **Proof**: From Theorem {prf:ref}`thm-cinf-regularity`:
779: 
780: $$
781: K_{V,m}(\rho) = C_{\text{Gevrey}}(\rho_0) \cdot \rho_0^{-m} \cdot m!
782: $$
783: 
784: for ρ ≤ ρ_0. Set C_K = C_Gevrey, A_K = ρ_0^{-1}:
785: 
786: $$
787: \|\nabla^m V_{\text{fit}}\| \leq C_K \cdot A_K^m \cdot m!
788: $$

hints.label: rmk-gevrey-not-analytic-cinf
hints.title: Why Gevrey-1, Not Real Analytic?
hints.content:
794: :label: rmk-gevrey-not-analytic-cinf
795: 
796: Despite the Gaussian kernel being real analytic, V_fit fails real analyticity due to:
797: 
798: 1. **Variable alive set**: The sum ∑_{j ∈ A_k} involves k-dependent number of terms, where k changes as walkers die. Not a finite composition of analytic functions.
799: 
800: 2. **Normalization non-analyticity**: w_ij = K_ij / (∑_ℓ K_iℓ) has denominator depending on alive set. While smooth, may fail holomorphic extension if zeros of denominator cluster near real axis.
801: 
802: 3. **Hermite polynomial growth**: Bounds |H_m(y)| ~ √(m!) are **sub-factorial**, insufficient to guarantee Taylor series convergence.
hints.raw_directive:
791: :::
792: 
793: :::{prf:remark} Why Gevrey-1, Not Real Analytic?
794: :label: rmk-gevrey-not-analytic-cinf
795: 
796: Despite the Gaussian kernel being real analytic, V_fit fails real analyticity due to:
797: 
798: 1. **Variable alive set**: The sum ∑_{j ∈ A_k} involves k-dependent number of terms, where k changes as walkers die. Not a finite composition of analytic functions.
799: 
800: 2. **Normalization non-analyticity**: w_ij = K_ij / (∑_ℓ K_iℓ) has denominator depending on alive set. While smooth, may fail holomorphic extension if zeros of denominator cluster near real axis.
801: 
802: 3. **Hermite polynomial growth**: Bounds |H_m(y)| ~ √(m!) are **sub-factorial**, insufficient to guarantee Taylor series convergence.
803:

hints.label: prop-gevrey-regularization-cinf
hints.title: Gevrey Regularization Property
hints.content:
808: :label: prop-gevrey-regularization-cinf
809: 
810: If d ∈ G^s(X) for some s ≥ 1, then V_fit ∈ G^{min(s, 1)}(X). In particular:
811: - d real analytic (s < 1) → V_fit ∈ G¹
812: - d ∈ G¹ → V_fit ∈ G¹ (preserved)
813: - d ∈ G^s (s > 1) → V_fit ∈ G¹ (regularization)
814: 
815: **Interpretation**: The Gaussian localization kernel **regularizes** the measurement to at least Gevrey-1, regardless of input regularity (as long as d ∈ C∞). Analogous to heat kernel smoothing.
